item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Always do what you are afraid to do." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Without ambition one starts nothing. Without work one finishes nothing. The prize will not be sent to you. You have to win it." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There is a time in every man's education when he arrives at the conviction that envy is ignorance; that imitation is suicide; that he must take himself for better, for worse, as his portion; that though the wide universe is full of good, no kernel of nourishing corn can come to him but through his toil bestowed on that plot of ground which is given to him to till. The power which resides in him is new in nature, and none but he knows what that is which he can do, nor does he know until he has tried." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Whoso would be a man must be a nonconformist." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Guard well your spare moments. They are like uncut diamonds. Discard them and their value will never be known. Improve them and they will become the brightest gems in a useful life." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Emerson
item.description: "Old and new make the warp and woof of every moment. There is no thread that is not a twist of these two strands. By necessity, by proclivity, and by delight, we all quote." -- Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by ralph waldo emerson
item.description: "Nature hates calculators." -- ralph waldo emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "One of the illusions of life is that the present hour is not the critical, decisive hour. Write it on your hear that every day is the best day of the year." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lily add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Lily add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Listen--are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Lily add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"<b>The Poet With His Face In His Hands</b>
You want to cry aloud for your mistakes. But to tell the truth the world doesn’t need anymore of that sound.
So if you’re going to do it and can’t stop yourself, if your pretty mouth can’t hold it in, at least go by yourself across
the forty fields and the forty dark inclines of rocks and water to the place where the falls are flinging out their white sheets
like crazy, and there is a cave behind all that jubilation and water fun and you can stand there, under it, and roar all you
want and nothing will be disturbed; you can drip with despair all afternoon and still, on a green branch, its wings just lightly touched
by the passing foil of the water, the thrush, puffing out its spotted breast, will sing of the perfect, stone-hard beauty of everything." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Lily add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "When despair for the world grows in me and I wake in the night at the least sound in fear of what my life and my children's lives may be, I go and lie down where the wood drake rests in his beauty on the water, and the great heron feeds. I come into the peace of wild things who do not tax their lives with forethought of grief. I come into the presence of still water. And I feel above me the day-blind stars waiting with their light. For a time I rest in the grace of the world, and am free." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Lily add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Don't own so much clutter that you will be relieved to see your house catch fire." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Lily add a quote by Jalal Ad-Din Rumi
item.description:
"Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field. I'll meet you there.
When the soul lies down in that grass the world is too full to talk about." -- Jalal Ad-Din Rumi

item.title: Lily add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Birds make great sky-circles of their freedom. How do they learn it? They fall and falling, they're given wings." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Lily add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let the beauty we love be what we do. There are hundreds of ways to kneel and kiss the ground." -- Rumi

item.title: Lily add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let yourself be drawn by the stronger pull of that which you truly love." -- Rumi

item.title: Lily add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi

item.title: Lily add a quote by Rumi Jalalud-Din
item.description: "Two there are who are never satisfied -- the lover of the world and the lover of knowledge." -- Rumi Jalalud-Din

item.title: Lily add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lily add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Lily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lily add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain
